DataElement.preferredName: Exon Microarray Reporter Genomic Orientation GenomicOrientation
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.:A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Also refers to any substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved._The orientation of a genomic element on the double stranded molecule._Genomic strand orientation

The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Concepts.definition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.

A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.

A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Also refers to any substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved.

Property.preferredDefinition: The orientation of a genomic element on the double stranded molecule.

Concepts.definition: The orientation of a genomic element on the double stranded molecule.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/2/11 - Released as part of caArray v2.4 model cleanup.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a DNA sequence complementary to that of a messenger RNA molecule; the non-coding strand in double-stranded DNA.

Concepts.definition: Having a DNA sequence complementary to that of a messenger RNA molecule; the non-coding strand in double-stranded DNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a DNA sequence identical to that of a messenger RNA molecule; the coding strand in double-stranded DNA.

Concepts.definition: Having a DNA sequence identical to that of a messenger RNA molecule; the coding strand in double-stranded DNA.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/2/11 - Released as part of caArray v2.4 model cleanup.
